info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-livetools-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for live tools operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2024-2025 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Other Services
**Paths:** 25

get.description: Response of the IP ping operation (collection)
Response of the IP ping operation
Response of the IP ping operation (collection)
Response of the IP ping operation

ni-type.description:
Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is
         net-inst-default, the name is not meaningful

host-ip.description: The IP address of the network node at each hop for MTR operation

probe-num.description: Sequence number assigned to each probe packet

result.description: Result of each probe packet sent

ip-addr.description: IP address of the device on that particular hop

hop-num.description:
Sequential identifier of network hop
         encountered during trace route request

job-id.description:
The ID is a unique identifier generated per successful the MTR
         actions RPC request. It allows us to retrieve the operational
         data associated with a specific ID. This is useful for matching an action
         RPC response ID with the corresponding operational data

error.description:
Contain the error reason of the MTR request processing
         if there is any, otherwise specified as 'mtr-err-none'

ni-type.description:
Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is
         net-inst-default, the name is not meaningful

count.description: The number of traceroute/ping probes or packets to be sent to each hop along the traceroute path

port.description: Destination port to send UDP packets

min-ttl.description: Minimum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

max-ttl.description: Maximum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

dscp-ascii.description: DSCP ASCII value selected from a set of known DSCP options

req-info.description: Relevant information carried from the MTR request

job-info.description: Status of the MTR request processing

host-num.description: The number of hops on the route from the system to the target host

host-ip.description: The IP address of the network node at each hop for MTR operation

loss-prcnt.description: The percentage of packets lost at each hop

sent.description: The total number of packets sent at each hop

last.description: The latency of the last packet, in milliseconds

avg.description: The average latency of all packets sent to this hop, in milliseconds

best.description: The lowest (best) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

worst.description: The highest (worst) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

stdev.description: The standard deviation of the latency values for each hop, in milliseconds

resp-info.description: Response information of the MTR request

port.description: Destination port to send UDP packets

dscp.description: Numeric value of DSCP used during traffic generation

client-rcv.description:
Flag to indicate that client should receive/read
         data from server instead of the default mode of writing data to
         server for throughput measurement

bytes.description:
Bytes transferred between client and server
         for the throughput measurement. Data transfer is supported in both
         directions on the client. The direction is 'transmit' by default.
         'Receive' is effective only when 'client-rcv' flag is set.

elapsed-time.description: Time elapsed since the start of data sent/received

error-type.description: Contains an error type if encountered during throughput calculation

thrpt.description: Calculated throughput, in bits per second

Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is
         net-inst-default, the name is not meaningful

Flag to indicate that client should receive/read

thrpt-info.description: Throughput related data for the throughput action RPC execution

egress-if-name.description: Force traffic to use a specific egress interface, bypassing standard routing

next-hop.description: Force traffic to use a specific LAN IP nexthop address

seq-num.description: Sequence number assigned to the ICMP echo

status.description: Status of the ICMP echo sent

latency.description: Round-trip time for the ICMP echo

latency-msec.description: Round-trip time in milliseconds for the ICMP echo

aaaa-qry.description: DNS query for IPv6 address lookup

id.description: Identification field information of DNS response header

flags.description: Flags information of DNS response header

qdcount.description: Number of questions for which DNS response is received

ancount.description: Number of answers resource records present in the DNS response

nscount.description: Number of authority resource records present in the DNS response

arcount.description: Number of additional resource records present in the DNS response

query-name.description:
This field repeats the domain name from the original DNS query,
         confirming the response is for the correct domain

dscp.description: Numeric value of DSCP used during traffic generation

client-rcv.description:
Flag to indicate that client should receive/read
         data from server instead of the default mode of writing data to
         server for throughput measurement

bytes.description:
Bytes transferred between client and server
         for the throughput measurement. Data transfer is supported in both
         directions on the client. The direction is 'transmit' by default.
         'Receive' is effective only when 'client-rcv' flag is set.

elapsed-time.description: Time elapsed since the start of data sent/received

error-type.description: Contains an error type if encountered during throughput calculation

thrpt.description: Calculated throughput, in bits per second

job-id.description:
The ID is a unique identifier generated per successful
         throughput actions RPC request. It allows us to retrieve the operational
         data associated with a specific ID. This is useful for matching an action
         RPC response ID with the corresponding operational data

min-ttl.description: Minimum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

max-ttl.description: Maximum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

dscp-ascii.description: DSCP ASCII value selected from a set of known DSCP options

host-ip.description: The IP address of the network node at each hop for MTR operation

host-num.description: The number of hops on the route from the system to the target host

loss-prcnt.description: The percentage of packets lost at each hop

sent.description: The total number of packets sent at each hop

last.description: The latency of the last packet, in milliseconds

avg.description: The average latency of all packets sent to this hop, in milliseconds

best.description: The lowest (best) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

worst.description: The highest (worst) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

stdev.description: The standard deviation of the latency values for each hop, in milliseconds

job-id.description:
The ID is a unique identifier generated per successful the MTR
         actions RPC request. It allows us to retrieve the operational
         data associated with a specific ID. This is useful for matching an action
         RPC response ID with the corresponding operational data

error.description:
Contain the error reason of the MTR request processing
         if there is any, otherwise specified as 'mtr-err-none'

ni-type.description:
Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is
         net-inst-default, the name is not meaningful

count.description: The number of traceroute/ping probes or packets to be sent to each hop along the traceroute path

port.description: Destination port to send UDP packets

min-ttl.description: Minimum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

max-ttl.description: Maximum value of time to live(TTL) for an IP packet

dscp-ascii.description: DSCP ASCII value selected from a set of known DSCP options

req-info.description: Relevant information carried from the MTR request

job-info.description: Status of the MTR request processing

host-num.description: The number of hops on the route from the system to the target host

host-ip.description: The IP address of the network node at each hop for MTR operation

loss-prcnt.description: The percentage of packets lost at each hop

sent.description: The total number of packets sent at each hop

last.description: The latency of the last packet, in milliseconds

avg.description: The average latency of all packets sent to this hop, in milliseconds

best.description: The lowest (best) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

worst.description: The highest (worst) latency of all packets sent to the hop, in milliseconds

stdev.description: The standard deviation of the latency values for each hop, in milliseconds

resp-info.description: Response information of the MTR request

tags.name: Cisco-IOS-XE-livetools-oper

This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for live tools operational data.
